author: @wymt
title: Officials urge caution as high winds fuel car fire
text:
Officials urge caution as high winds fuel car fire
LONDON, Ky. (WYMT) - Strong winds swept through Eastern Kentucky Tuesday night and Wednesday, causing and intensifying fires in the region. A car fire in London quickly escalated due to the conditions.
ORIGINAL STORY:
Fire officials said the driver of the vehicle noticed smoke while driving along Highway 192 and pulled into the Frisch’s Big Boy parking lot. Moments later, flames engulfed the car from the engine to the trunk.
Battalion Chief Ricky George with the London City Fire Department said crews arrived to find the car fully involved. It took two fire trucks and about 20 minutes to put out the flames. However, high winds made containment even more challenging.
”Fire feeds off of oxygen, and the wind just kept building the fire more and more,” George explained.
Firefighters also had to deal with burning fluids spreading across the parking lot due to the vehicle’s gas tank melting.
”I would say percentage-wise, it probably ups it 30 to 40% just for a simple fact you’re having to fight the fire plus the wind and you got fluids pushing everywhere,” George said. ”At first, it’s a losing battle, but my guys last night got it contained pretty quick and got a good knockdown on it.”
The cause of the fire remains under investigation, but officials said it serves as a warning about the dangers of fire season.
Pete Geogerian, a hydrologist with the National Weather Service in Jackson, said wind speeds in Laurel County reached more than 40 miles per hour, worsening fire conditions in the area.
”Wind is probably the single biggest effect on fire behavior,” Geogerian said. ”So anytime you get strong winds, those fire lengths just grow exponentially. And we did have a red flag warning yesterday because of the high winds and also the dry air mass that was in place leading up to the rain that eventually came in overnight.”
No one was seriously hurt in the fire, though the driver was checked out for smoke inhalation. Meanwhile, fire and weather officials warn that similar conditions could spark more fires in the coming weeks.
From now until April 30, burning is prohibited between 6 a.m. and 6 p.m. within 150 feet of the woods or brush. Officials urge residents to follow local burn bans and take precautions to prevent wildfires.

author: Listin Diario
title: Semblanza de Javier Peña Núñez ante sentido fallecimiento
text: semblanza Semblanza de Javier Peña Núñez ante sentido fallecimiento Nació en la comunidad de Baitoa, Santiago, donde cursó los estudios de primaria y luego completo la secundaria en el Liceo Onésimo Jiménez de esa ciudad. Se desempeñó como profesor en su pueblo natal, siguiendo una tradición familiar, ya que sus padres también fueron formadores de niños que luego se convirtieron en destacados profesionales. Ingreso a la Universidad Católica Madre y Maestra donde se graduó con honores de la licenciatura en Trabajo Social, en la promoción del año 1971. Por sus méritos académicos, obtuvo una beca para especializarse en los Estados Unidos haciendo una maestría en Desarrollo Comunitario, en la Universidad de Madison, Wisconsin. Año más tarde, se graduó de Abogado, también con honores en la Pucamayma, aunque su pasión y orgullo en el ejercicio profesional fue su desempeño como Trabajador Social. Fue uno de los pioneros en incursionar en el Trabajo Social Municipal, creando un departamento en el Ayuntamiento del municipio de Santiago; ocupando más luego las funciones de Regidor y Presidente del Concejo edilicio. Fue nombrado en el gobierno de Jorge Blanco en la posición de Gobernador de la Provincia de Santiago y también se desempeñó como Vicepresidente y Asesor de la Liga Municipal Dominicana. Fue profesor y director de la carrera de Trabajo Social en la Pucamayma de Santiago, mereciendo el reconocimiento de todos sus alumnos por sus conocimientos y capacidad de transmitir sus experiencias. En su desempeño profesional ejerció la función pública de Presidente Administrador del Instituto de Desarrollo y Crédito Cooperativo ( IDECOOP), durante dos periodos, en los gobiernos de Jorge Blanco e Hipólito Mejía. Javier Peña tuvo una trayectoria de éxitos en el fomento y desarrollo del cooperativismo dominicano, promoviendo las cooperativas escolares, organizando y creando cooperativas de limpiabotas, turísticas, eléctricas, en las zonas franca, también cooperativas de producción, de regantes, de pescadores en la zona sur del país, así como la cooperativa minera de larimar con artesanos de la Ciénaga, Barahona. Además, desarrollo programas especiales orientados a la mujer, a la juventud y al fomento de la pesca. Su gestión priorizo la formación e incorporación de grupos cooperativos en todo el país. Solo en el periodo del 2001 al 2004 se promovieron más 235 cooperativas y se rehabilitaron igual número que estaban desarticuladas. Se fortalecieron los vínculos del Idecoop con las superestructuras del cooperativismo nacional, como la Federación Nacional de Cooperativas, la Federación de Cooperativas de los camioneros, así como con la Federación de Cooperativas Agropecuarias de El Pozo, Nagua. En su gestión se elaboró un protocolo para ser consensuado con el cooperativismo nacional para el fortalecimiento de las Federaciones y la Confederación Nacional, en interés de asegurar el fortalecimiento y la sostenibilidad de esas estructuras. La educación cooperativa fue uno de los principales objetivos de esa gestión, orientada fundamentalmente a crear estructuras multiplicadoras y auto sostenibles que coadyuvaran al empoderamiento de los socios en sus emprendimientos. Se sensibilizo al liderazgo del sector sobre la importancia de fortalecer el componente educativo, lográndose en las cooperativas la constitución y capacitación de los equipos humanos responsables de estas tareas de manera autogestionaria. A nivel institucional, se preparó un equipo técnico de alta calidad, en capacidad de responder a las demandas educativas del sector. También se introdujo como eje transversal de las cooperativas la perspectiva de género, la cual permitiría ir creando criterios de igualdad y equidad entre hombres y mujeres, a fin de afianzar el liderazgo y los niveles de participación de estas en los proyectos orientados a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus familias. En esta gestión se promovieron y se formaron los Consejos Regionales de Vigilancia en procura del fortalecimiento de ese importante órgano de fiscalización y control de las cooperativas, para crear conciencia sobre el manejo idóneo de los recursos de los socios. En ese periodo se inició el proceso de organización de los motoconclistas en la provincia Santo Domingo, Monseñor Nouel y Azua, con el propósito de crear cooperativas locales y avanzar en la constitución de una Federación Nacional de ese importante sector. Este legado aportado por la gestión de Javier Peña al movimiento cooperativo dominicano, contribuyo a que hoy el cooperativismo en nuestro país, como libre asociación de individuos y familias, contribuya al desarrollo económico y social, impactando positivamente en la calidad de vida, de amplios sectores poblacionales, pero, sobre todo, a aquellos afectados por la extrema pobreza. El cooperativismo ha demostrado ser instrumento para hacer frente a las necesidades y aspiraciones económicas, sociales y culturales, de aquellos que voluntariamente han decidido gestionar un cambio en su vida. Fuente: Informe de gestión de fecha 10 de octubre del 2001 elaborado por la TS Elba Franco, Sub Administradora de Desarrollo ( IDECOOP)

author: 中央通訊社
title: 丹娜絲颱風災後嘉南仍487戶停電 台電持續搶修
text:
丹娜絲颱風災後嘉南仍487戶停電 台電持續搶修
（中央社記者姜宜菁、蔡智明、張榮祥嘉義17日電）丹娜絲颱風災後電力搶修進入第11天，嘉義縣和台南市仍有487戶停電，台電公司持續搶修，由於嘉義縣復電工程發生工安事件，職安署勒令該分歧線路停工，台電說，不影響進度。
根據台電公司天然災害停復電查詢顯示，截至今天早上10時止，全國曾停電用戶數100萬6926戶，目前仍停電用戶數487戶，分別為嘉義縣有425戶和台南市62戶停電。
一名台電工作人員15日在嘉義縣義竹鄉搶修電力時遭電擊命危，職安署南區職安中心昨天勞檢，指個人防護具未確實使用，該饋線作業停工至台電改善為止，後續並開罰。
台電公司嘉義區營業處表示，雖然該分歧線路被勒令停工，但復電在即，台電人員將繞道而行，透過其他線路拉線到該分歧線路的下游，不會影響復電期程，職安署今天也要求台電公司提出復工計畫，待計畫核定後，工作人員會即刻進場修復線路。
台電嘉義區營業處表示，嘉義縣尚有425戶待修復，集中於義竹鄉、布袋鎮沿海堤岸、魚塭及偏遠小徑等區域。雖然全面復電近在眼前，但目前剩餘無電戶多位於線路末端，需逐桿立柱、逐段架線，作業難度明顯提升。
為加快搶修速度，台電持續採取「分段、同步」策略，並感謝在地里長逐戶協助通報、引導路線，使搶修行動更為順暢。
民進黨立委蔡易餘告訴中央社記者，現在主幹線都復電了，但接下來是巷弄戰，必須要深入很多平常難以到達的地方復電，他會持續協商調派迷你怪手和夾仔車，排除魚塭產業道路、偏遠小徑的障礙。
追蹤中央社
台電公司新營區營業處指出，截至今天上午10時，台南溪北13個行政區災後累計停電19萬4790戶，如今已復電19萬4728戶，尚有學甲區57戶、北門區1戶及白河區4戶共62戶停電修復中。
新營區處表示，未復電主因是現場環境受限或用戶端因素，包含魚塭周邊道路泥濘鬆軟、搶修車輛無法進入，用戶自備電桿倒塌及房屋毀損等。（編輯：龍柏安）1140717

author: Redazione Web
title: Antonio Fantin Reclaims Paralympic Gold in 100m Freestyle S6
text: Antonio Fantin is still the king of the 100m freestyle S6. The Italian swimmer, after his triumph in Tokyo, won the Paralympic gold medal again with a perfect performance in the final where he gave no chance to his opponents. [Who is Alberto Amodeo, the Italian who triumphed in the 400m freestyle: age, career, the accident, and the passion for Lego](/sport/schede/alberto_amodeo_chi_e_paralimpiadi_incidente_medagia_oro_400_stile_libero_eta_carriera_passione_lego-8334161.html) The 23-year-old Italian secured the gold, repeating his success from 2021 and finishing in 1:03.12, a Paralympic record. Silver went to the Brazilian Talisson Henrique Glock (1:05.27), and bronze to the Frenchman Laurent Chardard. Who he is Antonio Fantin was born in Latisana on August 3, 2001. The Italian lives in Bibione and trains in Lignano Sabbiadoro, at the Bella Italia Village pool. He is just 23 years old but already has an impressive track record. Career and titles Antonio Fantin is the Paralympic champion in the 100m freestyle at the Tokyo 2020 Games, a 10-time world champion, and a 9-time European champion. He holds world and European records in the 50m and 100m freestyle. The Italian has just reaffirmed his gold medal in Paris, setting a new Paralympic record. The malformation and the passion for swimming Fantin was struck in February 2005, at the age of three and a half, by an arteriovenous malformation. He later approached the world of swimming as a form of post-operative rehabilitation, as he recounted in his autobiography. His nickname Antonio Fantin is nicknamed "the dolphin of Bibione". His world titles and two Paralympic golds have made him famous and highlighted his immense talent shown in the water. This article is automatically translated

author: 证券之星融资融券
title: 皖新传媒：6月18日融资净买入674.35万元，连续3日累计净买入1336.27万元_股票频道_证券之星
text:
证券之星消息，6月18日，皖新传媒（601801）融资买入1134.98万元，融资偿还460.63万元，融资净买入674.35万元，融资余额1.62亿元，近3个交易日已连续净买入累计1336.27万元。
融券方面，当日融券卖出1.35万股，融券偿还0.0股，融券净卖出1.35万股，融券余量17.84万股，近3个交易日已连续净卖出累计3.04万股，近20个交易日中有12个交易日出现融券净卖出。
融资融券余额1.63亿元，较昨日上涨4.38%。
小知识
融资融券 ：融资余额是指融资买入股票的金额与融资偿还的金额之间的差额。如果融资余额增加，说明投资者心态偏向买方，市场受欢迎，是强势市场；反之，则属于弱势市场。融券余额是指每日卖出的融券金额与偿还的融券金额之间的差额。融券余额增加，说明市场趋向卖方市场；相反，它倾向于买方。
以上内容为证券之星据公开信息整理，由AI算法生成（网信算备310104345710301240019号），不构成投资建议。

author: CA WILDFIRE BOT
title: Wildfire breaks out in Placer County, CA | Modesto Bee
text:
Fires
Breaking: Delmar Fire reported in Placer County on May 7
The creation of this content included the use of AI based on templates created, reviewed and edited by journalists in the newsroom. Read more on our AI policy here.
First discovered: 1:44 p.m. May 7
Initial location: Placer County, Calif.
Fire type: Wildfire
Fire name: Delmar
A new wildfire was reported today at 1:44 p.m. in Placer County.
Delmar Fire has been burning on private land. Currently, there is no data on the containment status of the fire and the cause has yet to be determined.
Source: National Interagency Fire Center

author: Arielle Haughee
title: Strengthening the Crummer Network: Welcoming New Leaders to the Crummer Alumni Board
text:
In This Section In This Section Explore All News Strengthening the Crummer Network: Welcoming New Leaders to the Crummer Alumni Board The Crummer Alumni Board is more than just a group of dedicated graduates—it’s a driving force behind the continued success of the Crummer Graduate School of Business. This service group donates their time, talent, and energy to benefit the school and its alumni, planning events, sponsoring initiatives, collaborating with various departments, and continually striving for the betterment of the Crummer community. The board’s active participation is crucial in maintaining a strong and vibrant alumni network.
We are pleased to announce the addition of two distinguished alumni to the board: Candy Cole ’13MBA and Terry Castillo ’21MBA. Their diverse backgrounds, combined with their commitment to giving back, will significantly enhance the board’s efforts. Learn more about these talented alums and discover why they decided to serve in this vital role.
Candy Cole In April 2023, Candy Cole became the Executive Director of the Lake Nona Regional Chamber of Commerce, where she is dedicated to serving members, forging strategic partnerships, and fostering economic growth. Candy believes that building a thriving community requires strong connections, attentive listening, and providing the necessary support to help individuals and organizations succeed.
Candy describes herself as a “maker”—someone who learns, educates, and shares innovative ideas with others. As a collaborative, mission-driven leader with a proven history of building community support for nonprofit organizations, she has utilized her broad skill set to manage nonprofits and assist entrepreneurs and small businesses across Central Florida.
With an MBA from Crummer and a BS in Accounting from the University of Central Florida, Candy is passionate about using her skills to help others. She believes everyone should have access to the tools, knowledge, and resources needed to realize their dreams.
Terry Castillo Teresa “Terry” Castillo is a dynamic learning and development leader based in Kissimmee, Florida, and the Founder and Lead Strategist at Blue Hawk Strategies. She designs innovative, customized learning journeys that significantly boost team performance and productivity. As a School Board Member for Osceola County since 2018, Terry manages a $1.7 billion budget, champions educational equity, and fosters strong partnerships between schools and the community.
Terry’s career includes leadership roles such as Director of Training and Delivery at Right to Be, where she led global training initiatives for major clients like L’Oréal Paris and Sephora, and Manager of Learning and Development at the Orange County Clerk of Courts. With her roots in training and delivery at Bright House Networks/Charter Communications, Terry has a proven track record of enhancing learning retention and skill application.
Terry holds an MBA from Crummer and a BS in Legal Studies from Barry University. She is certified in Six Sigma White Belt, Storyline Articulate, Introduction to AI, and The Pinnacle Method Facilitation.
Q & A Why did you decide to lend your time and talents to the alumni board?  
Candy Cole: I joined the alumni board so I could help foster a sense of community, continue to develop and enhance my leadership skills, stay engaged with other leaders, develop meaningful relationships with fellow board members and alumni, and stay current regarding trends and developments that may impact the business community
Terry Castillo: As someone who gained immensely from the Crummer experience, I am eager to give back to the community that has given me so much.
What skills did you learn or experiences did you have from your MBA that you believe will help you in the position? 
Candy Cole: In my time at Crummer, I learned that the smartest person in the room often listens more than they speak. I learned how to really work to understand the perspectives of others and take those into account when dealing with a challenge. Working with people with vastly different personalities and skill sets was difficult, but it taught me a lot about being part of a high-performing team. I learned that you have to go slow to go fast; in other words, don’t rush to action. It is critical to take the time to develop a strategy and a plan and then turn that into a roadmap to achieve the goal. I also learned a lot about conflict resolution and how to respectfully disagree and resolve differences.
Terry Castillo: I have applied the knowledge from every class I’ve taken in various ways. However, my ability to use data to tell a story and build a compelling case for my professional recommendations is a skill that I believe distinguishes me from many other professionals.
What do you hope to achieve or assist with as a board member? 
Candy Cole: I enjoy adding value to the lives of others. I hope to experience the fulfillment that comes with giving back by helping others achieve their educational or professional goals, serve the school as well as the community, and bring awareness to the programs and initiatives that benefit students and alumni
Terry Castillo: I aim to enhance alumni engagement, with a particular focus on increasing participation from those who graduated within the past 10 years.
What do you believe are the benefits of participating on the alumni board? 
Candy Cole: There are so many benefits to participating on the alumni board. For me, these include engaging with diverse groups of individuals and other community leaders, staying informed about school programs and initiatives, improving my leadership and communication skills, and helping foster a sense of community among alumni.  
Terry Castillo: I have thoroughly enjoyed getting to know my fellow board members and learning from their experiences. Additionally, I appreciate the opportunity to network with current students and offer insights on how they can maximize their experience at Crummer.
The addition of Candy Cole and Terry Castillo to the Crummer Alumni Board is a testament to the strength and dedication of Crummer’s alumni community. Their diverse experiences and commitment to giving back will undoubtedly enhance the board’s efforts in supporting the school and its graduates. As they take on their new roles, both Candy and Terry bring valuable skills and fresh perspectives that will contribute to the continued growth and success of the Crummer network. Their involvement underscores the importance of alumni engagement in fostering a vibrant and connected Crummer community.
Looking forward to the next alumni event? Click here to learn about upcoming alumni happenings.

author: CNN Newsource staff
title: Community feasts on crocodile that ate family pets
text:
(CNN) – Police in a remote town in Australia removed a problem crocodile from the community on Wednesday.
According to the Northern Territory Police, the crocodile terrorized the town of Bulla recently by lunging out of the water at children and eating multiple dogs.
After shooting the reptile, police said they took it into town where the locals prepared it for a traditional feast.
Police said the 3.63 meter-long, or 11.9 foot-long, croc moved into the Baines River near residences after floods from earlier in the year.
A community in Australia ate the crocodile that had taken several of their pets. (Norther Territory Police) Police said a crocodile safety session was also conducted by Parks and Wildlife with children to give them an up-close look at the dangers within the waterways.
“Crocodiles can pose a significant risk to community safety,” Commander Kylie Anderson said. “Thanks to the seamless collaboration between Parks and Wildlife, our remote police staff, and local residents we were able to safely remove the large saltie and maintain the safety of the community.”
Speaking about the crocodile wrangling, officials added “There’s never a dull moment in remote policing.”
